2.heading: Superhero (the word).
2.title: "The Roots of the Superman!"
2.author: by Will Murray
2.appears_in: p. 19-21, 68 in Comic Book Marketplace, v. 2, no. 63 (Sept/Oct. 1998).
notes: Discusses the origins of the term "superhero."

3.title: Superhero
3.author: Marc Tauss.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Maleek and his robot Marvyn travel to the past to find trees and plants to restore the city that tall buildings have taken over.

4.title: "Superhero"
4.author: most bits by Angus McKie , other bits by Alan Craddock
4.appears_in: p. 37-40 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 2 (May 1982).

5.title: Superhero : a Biography of Christopher Reeve
5.author: Chris Nickson.

7.title: Superhero : the Secret Origin of a Genre
7.author: by Peter Coogan ; introduction by Denny O'Neil.

8.heading: Superhero Academies.
8.title: The Curse of the Bologna Sandwich
8.author: Greg Trine ; illustrated by Rhode Montijo.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): After graduating from the superhero academy, Melvin Beederman heads for Los Angeles, where he unexpectedly teams up with Candace Brinkwater, school play actress, to nab the evil McNasty Brothers.

9.heading: A Superhero Adventure.
9.title: Quest of Qui
9.author: by Kenneth Robeson ; cover by Ben Otero ; illustrated by Arnie Kohn.
notes: At head of title: Doc Savage. I. Robeson, Kenneth. II. Doc Savage. III. Series. Call no.: PS3535.O2Q4 1975

10.heading: Superhero and Supervillain School.
10.title: Kid Gravity
10.author: written by Landry Quinn Walker ; illustrated by Eric Jones ; colors by Michael "Rusty" Drake, Garry Black, and Rikki Simons ; letters by Michael Stewart and Chris Dickey.
notes: "Hey! This book came from Disney adventures."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Kid Gravity, a student at superhero and supervillian school, has many adventures in the future as he tries to defeat his evil nemesis, Kid Apocalypse.

11.title: Superhero Annual.
11.author: [No author]
notes: Other titles: Model and Toy Collector Super Hero Annual; Model and Toy Collector Magazine's Superhero Annual.
Collectors and collecting. 3. Comic art paraphernalia. I. [Other titles] II. Cap'n Penny Productions. Call no.: PN6714.S79

12.title: The Superhero as Messiah
12.author: by Chris Carpenter.
notes: Paper presented at the Comics Arts Conference, July 20-23, 2006, San Diego, Calif.

13.title: The Superhero Book : the Ultimate Encyclopedia of Comic-Book Icons and Hollywood Heroes
13.author: edited by Gina Misiroglu with David A

14.heading: The Superhero Book--Miscellanea.
14.title: "Superhero Encyclopedia Published" p. 47 in The Comics Journal, no. 267

19.title: The Superhero Catalogue.
19.author: [No author]
notes: Two different issues bear the numbering v. 1, no. 5 (Fall 1977); another two are numbered v. 6 (Spring 1978) and one of these has a number 3 on the cover; an issue called v. 7 (Fall 1978) has a number 4 on the cover.
